info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued July 29 at 6:57PM EDT until July 29 at 7:15PM EDT by NWS Raleigh
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 715 PM EDT FOR NORTHWESTERN MOORE...NORTHEASTERN MONTGOMERY AND SOUTHEASTERN RANDOLPH COUNTIES... At 656 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located near Biscoe, or 7 miles northeast of Troy, moving east at 20 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts, heavy rain, and frequent lightning. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... Troy, Biscoe, Seagrove, Robbins, Star and Steeds. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Straight line winds can blow down trees, power lines, and damage mobile homes and other buildings. Seek shelter in a sturdy structure until the storm has passed. Stay away from windows as flying debris generated by damaging winds can be deadly. Torrential rainfall is occurring with this storm, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
